title: General Motors (GM) Recalls 73,424 Cobalts in US & Canada
text: Content preferences Done General Motors Co. GM announced a recall of 73,424 Chevrolet Cobalt compact cars in the U.S. and Canada owing to wiring issues which may obstruct deployment of the roof-mounted driver side airbag after a crash. Of the total number of vehicles recalled, 59,474 were from the U.S. and 13,950 from Canada. Also, majority of the recalled cars are Cobalts of model year 2010.General Motors will inform the owners about the wiring concern and assure them that dealers will inspect the problem and replace the faulty wiring at no extra cost. There is one report of injury owing to this problem.General Motors undertakes frequent recalls to address safety issues. However, regular recalls have an impact on consumer sentiment. In July this year, the car maker announced a recall of 780,000 crossover SUVs, mainly in North America, to rectify rear power lift gates that may drop suddenly and injure people. In the same month, General Motors announced a recall of around 196,379 Hummer SUVs worldwide to rectify the overheating of ventilation fan motor controls, which may even lead to a fire. In Jul 2015, the company made another recall of 155,000 vehicles in India to solve a wiring problem associated with a remote keyless entry accessory.In addition, General Motors has been facing the brunt of the delayed recall of 2.6 million vehicles with defective ignition switches, which may lead to a sudden shutdown of the engine and also prevent the deployment of front air bags in case of a crash.General Motors currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).Better-ranked automobile stocks include Harley-Davidson, Inc.
